name: Ayre Hotel Caspe

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hotel Caspe for three nights in early September. First impressions on entering the hotel were that this hotel had a modern contemporary look and feel to it, with bright, spacy areas and funky-looking furniture in the reception area. Staff were friendly and very helpful - on entering the room we found that the safe was not working and reported this immediately, at which point a member of staff was despatched straight away to our room to "fix" it. The room itself was nice and clean, and of a reasonable size with adequate furnishings and a decent bathroom. We had breakfast on the first morning, which was of a fairly good standard and of the usual hotel buffet variety, both hot and cold, but as is usual in hotels we felt the price was slightly too high and had breakfast elsewhere in cheaper cafes for the rest of our stay. The hotel is located in a fairly quiet street, with the nearest metro station about five minutes walk away. Placa Catalunya was about a twenty five minute walk away (ok, so we walk slowly but that's the best way to see a beautiful city like this!!), but there are a number of bars and restaurants nearby if you are feeling less energetic. Overall, I enjoyed this hotel. Good location, clean, decent room, friendly staff, reasonably priced and I would recommend it.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay at the Ayre Hotel Caspe...

likes.liked: — Good location; modern contemporary feel to the place; bright spacious foyer; decent clean room
likes.disliked: — Price of breakfast was a little high

reviews.text: The hotel is contemporary modern looking (for me, looked like everything was from Ikea) and clean. It was comfortable to stay but a little far from the city centre, not too far though. The nearest metro station is Tetuan and it is about 3 minutes walk. Later on, we found bus stops near by and it was easier to get to most of the popular site. On the second day of our stay, me and my friends booked the sauna, which is situated at the basement floor, so we let the receptionist know when we wanted to use as the hotel guide instructed to book it at least 90 minutes before the time we would like to use. It was great that the sauna was ready and hot when we got there. On the next day, we did the same but the receptionist (different person) said it is not necessary. However, the sauna was switched off and we had to switch it on and wait for 30-40 minutes until it get ready. Another thing I might mention is that there was noise of vacuum cleaner from the corridor every morning at around 9am. It was as loud as we couldn't stay in the bed. We booked the hotel with almost half of their proper price so it was okay, otherwise a bit of disappointment as it is a 4-star hotel.
reviews.title: Modern and clean but rather cold impression

likes.disliked: — noise of vacuum cleaner every morning

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staying in Barcelona in August is very hot and crowded, but I guess that that is one of the attractions of the city: the constant bustle, noise, cosmopolitan attraction of the place is both exhilerating and exhausting. The Hotel Ayre Caspe, however, is situated away from the hurley burley of the city, yet within comfortable walking distance of two metro stations Tetuan and Arc de Triomf - both of which are within easy access of the main Ramblas district.
reviews.title: Barcelona, Barcelona gorgeous Barcelona!!

reviews.text: The hotel itself is 4* and is very chic in its presentation. It is built round a great glass courtyard (a little reminiscent of the film The Matrix in a strange way). The staff were very courteous and accommodating (although our holiday was so problem free we only saw them at check in and check out). The room was the standard hotel room - the beds were hardish but I prefer them that way, the TV showed the Olympics, the curtains gave near blackout in the morning and the shower was excellent. Food is not included in the package and seems rather expensive if you do want to eat at the hotel. Every morning I made the 1 minute walk to the local cafe and had a cafe con leche and toast or croisant at a table outside watching the world go by - very cheap and very good service (Cafe Sol d'Or).
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.text: Getting round Barcelona is so easy. best value is to buy a T10 at the ticket machine which entitles you or your party 10 trips. During our stay my wife and I had a ticket each (actually 3 as there is so much to see) and on the last day we bought one and passed it backwards and forwards across the ticket reading machine - the ticket is designed for this purpose. It also allows you on the fantastic bus service and the train from the airport to the tube station Sants Estacio.
reviews.title: Poor service, too far from the Ramblas, No Wi-fi

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Read quite a few reviews on this hotel (and others in barcelona)
reviews.title: Excellent Value
Why is it so highly rated on TripAdvisor?
reviews.text: The price clinched it in the end (106 Euros a night) which seemed reasonable for barcelona

reviews.title: Excellent location, rooms, service
reviews.text: The room had a nice modern style and was certainly one of the better rooms I have stayed in. A nice touch was a bath and separate shower in the bathroom. There was free use of the safe and the aircon was permanently available (Some go off when you take the room card out).

The rooms are well insulated from the outside, but not so well insulated between the rooms so I could hear the people in the next room. In fairness though every hotel I have ever stayed in I have heard noise from the next room.
reviews.title: Really - Can Not Recommend This Hotel!!!!!

likes.liked: — I have been stolen my handbag at the bar of this hotel and I have NEVER ever seen such a lousy service, such a missing support by the staff like in this hotel. I have been travelling all over the world and still stay in different hotels on business-trips, but I have never seen something like this. There was not even an excuse by the staff, no support of delivering me the right phone number to cancel my Mastercard. I gave the number of Mastercard to the staff at the reception the day I left, although I do hope that this doesn't happen to any guest again. I had and stil have a hard time to get all my documents, money back. That's why I am writing this complaint. - There was no offer of anything or help of the hotel and again, as I can just repeat not even an excuse....- Unbelievable! They have security people and a camera in the hotel, but they seemed so uninteressed and it seems that several thefts have tried to get into the hotel, as I have been told by one of the security person. But the hotel didn't even show the film, which showed exactly how the theft happened, to all of the security staff. - Again, I have never seen such a bad service and as for your own security, I CAN'T RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were really helpful with one of them taking us down in the lift to show us where the jacuzzi and gym were. We arrived just after midday and they let us check in straight away.
reviews.title: Just OK... definitely not a 4 stars

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed in Ayre Hotel Caspe with my husband for two nights in August 2008. Having already spent about a week in BCN, we decided to further extend our stay, but our initial hotel didn't have any more vacancy and we had to change to this hotel instead. We chose it mainly because it offered a room at relatively low price, and seemed to be a modern and clean hotel. The hotel is located on a quiet side street of Gran Via and is bit far from everything, though still in the center. It was actually a little hard to find the hotel in the first place, because looking from the map, I had estimated it to be a lot closer to its nearest metro station 'Monumental'. Anyhow, the hotel is accessible by metro.
reviews.title: Very basic, a little dull

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There isn't anything badly wrong with the hotel or its rooms, but the overall feel is a little shabby, worn-out and IKEA-like and hence it most certainly isn't four star standard. The room minibar was filled with complimentary spring water, but so it is in most BCN hotels these days. I mean, with the same price, you can find better hotels with better location in BCN. However, if all other good hotels are fully booked and you get a nice offer, Ayre Hotel Caspe is an okay choice.
reviews.title: Good for a Barcelona city break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed two nights at the Ayre Caspe for a weekend break. With the pound as it is we struggled to find something nice but affordable, and I think we did manage to find it with the Ayre. It's not bang in the centre of town - about a fifteen minute walk to placa catalunya but there's a metro quite near by and taxis at night are cheap (10euros from the Gothic Quarter back to the hotel). The room was modern and clean, although it had twin beds pushed together as opposed to a double. Having said that the beds were really comfortable and we slept fantastically both nights. The lobby was nice and again very modern. The bar was good - not overpriced in the way hotel bars can be with a little outdoor sitting area where you can enjoy some lovely cava. Staff were helpful.
reviews.title: Clean, Fresh and Pleasant Hotel.

reviews.text: Overall we had a good stay at this hotel. The first impression is the very modern reception area. It was also always well presented, clean and cool.
reviews.title: Just what we wanted and great value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The area the hotel was located was very quiet, and is about 15 mins walk from las ramblas. If not mobile it is about 5 mins walk form metro station. You can go via the Barcelona Arc de Triomphe & gardens which is a lovely walk.
reviews.title: Extremely Poor Service at the Ayre Hotel Caspe
No ambience
reviews.text: The first disappointment came with the location of the hotel : it's not that close to a metro station (15 min. walk to Arc de Triumf) and quite far from any major tourist attraction (Closest would be the Familia Sagrada at 30 min. walk). There's nothing really of interest in the neighborhood and I'm still wondering why they chose that place to build a hotel as it suits neither a business trip need or a holiday break expectation...

reviews.title: Lovely Hotel - But beware
reviews.text: The staff is polite and speak several foreign languages (English, French...).

reviews.title: It was so so.
reviews.text: Rooms are large and clean, but the overall hotel interior "design" reminds me more of an Ikea showroom : the furniture is actually made of cheap materials and feels cold. We had a room on the street side : it was quite noisy at night.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was excellent in every aspect. It was very modern and simplistic in design but also very clean. It is a short walk to the nearest metro which links to every within the city but if you are feeling adventurous you can walk to many of the main attractions e.g las rambles and sagrada familia which are only 5-10 minute walks away. I would definately recomend this hotel and would definately go back I loved this hotel and Barcelona is an amazing city.
reviews.title: Excellent overrall hotel

reviews.text: We stayed at the Hotel Caspe for three nights in the mid of may.
reviews.title: Modern hotel in the outer area of Barcellona

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The lounge is modern,staff is kind, concierge suggested us nice shows in the city.
reviews.title: Clean hotel, good value

reviews.text: In ten minutes you can reach the nearest metro station (Tetuan) so to visit the city.
reviews.title: Nice minimal hotel

likes.liked: — the big size of the rooms
likes.disliked: — the only 2 days of our stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is rated 4 stars but furniture is chep (it seems from IKEA), room is not so big, cleanness is not excellent.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

likes.disliked: — No window in the room we had

reviews.title: was lovely!
reviews.text: I found the Ayre Hotel Caspe lovely. It's quite, modern and clean and not too expensive (room was 340 for 3 nights, booked from hotel website). The area is lovely, it's a residential area so not at all touristy or tacky and its only 15 walk into placa catlunya or 5 mins walk to metro stop of either arch triomphe or tetuan(with choice of more lines).

reviews.title: Not the greatest and shouldnt be a 4 star
reviews.text: I would mention on check-in that you want a double bed (i read on tripadvisor that they give two single beds pushed together otherwise). I would also say you would like one facing the street as the rooms are bigger. We had an room facing the internal courtyard and although the bed was huge the room itself was quite small and so was stuffy.

reviews.title: Excellent value for money
reviews.text: The bathroom was nice and big with a huge walk-in shower as well as bath. Towels and bed was attended to everyday and the bed was really comfy! The tv has channels from Spain,France,Germany and Italy and Uk (it's sky news but at least it's something).

reviews.title: Loved this place!
reviews.text: We didnt have breakfast included (its about €15 a head for continental...). Instead there is a fab cafe with bakery around the corner from the hotel. (go out foyer, turn right and take first left -it's across the road, they do huge fresh croissants and rolls for a few €.

reviews.title: Really comfortable
reviews.text: The staff were lovely except for one man who was possible the rudest person I have ever met. Besides him, they were extremely friendly and helpful in everyway.

reviews.title: Excellent Modern Hotel
reviews.text: As a number of other reviewers have commented this is a very modern style hotel. The lobby area feels a little cold and was generally devoid of guests. The bedrooms are excellent with ample room, substantial closet space and expansive work desk with free broadband Internet acess. As noted by others the bathroom was well fitted with a walk-in shower plus a tub with full shower; excellent water pressure and hot water.

reviews.title: Ultra modern with a slightly clinical feel and quite far from the action.
reviews.text: The front-desk staff were excellent, on check-in they didn't have my reservation (made directly on their Web site) but it took two minutes and everything was fine. We had planned on staying a total of six nights but after the first night we had to return home due to sickness, the desk agent was extremely solicitous and handled our check-out with no fuss or muss.

reviews.title: Very Poor Service
reviews.text: The bar and restaurant are small and appear almost an afterthought, and the night we were there poorly patronized. We were the only people in the dining room the whole evening. The food while not particularly adventurous was good and not unreasonably priced (the breakfast at Euro14 seemed high and so we intended skipping that). With the outstanding bedroom facilities but limited bar/restaurant It struck me as more of a business hotel than a tourist hotel; I'd be curious as to the original demographic target.

reviews.title: A Great Hotel. Perfect location.
reviews.text: We thought the location was pretty good, a little of the main track but a 15 to 20 minute walk to Plaça de Catalunya and the start of La Rambla or a five minute walk to Arc de Triomf and the Metro stop. Slightly tangential but my advice is to not take the train from the airport and then Metro, but take the Aeroporta express but to Plaça de Catalunya and then either walk or take a taxi to the hotel. Barcelona's Metro is the most unfriendly system I have encountered in a long time. To get from Barcelona-Sants Train Station to Arc de Triomf by Metro is a nightmare, endless stairs up and down (which with luggage is hard work), no escalator (actually just one), endless walks through subterranean tunnels and poor signage. There is supposedly a city train connecting Barcelona-Sants and Arc de Triomf but we couldn't find it and no one we asked was able to help; we must have phrased the question poorly I think.

reviews.title: Very Very Good
reviews.text: Overall I would rate the hotel exceptional value for money.

description: Ayre Hotel Caspe is a newly built hotel combining avant-garde design with a functional style in all of its facilities. The hotel features 141 fully equipped rooms with the most modern technology, a restaurant providing Mediterranean cuisine, a gym, a spa with sauna and Jacuzzi, a garage, and 9 open-plan meeting rooms. Situated in the central Eixample, Ayre Hotel Caspe is a mere 5 minutes from the city center and 20 minutes from the airport.
